Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 77th overall pick, by Boston (FBA) in 1980...
Injured on 5/2/1981 with a Sore Shoulder, out for 5 days...
Had first career hit on 4/23/1982, off Ernest Perkins (NE)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/14/1984, off Ernest Perkins (NE)...
Won World Championship with Boston (FBA) in 1985...
Injured on 4/4/1987 with a Spasms Back, out for 3 weeks...
Injured on 7/21/1988 with a Pulled Hamstring Muscle, out for one week...
Traded from Boston (FBA) to Gashouse on 2/6/1989 (Going to SHP: RF T. Nail. Going to GHG: 2B D. Ballweg, P S. Hidalgo, P R. Velez)...
Signed as a free agent by Wisconsin on 2/2/1990 to a 3-year deal worth $5,500,000 per year...
Was selected to the 1990 Allstar game...
